item.title: taylor swift goes to school in new 'story of us' video
item.description: in her new music video, taylor swift is a love-sick student at vanderbilt university. check out 'the story of us.'

item.title: wife of jailed china activist tells of eviction effort
item.description: the wife and daughter of the human rights activist hu jia may be forced out of their apartment shortly before mr. hu is scheduled to complete a prison sentence.

item.title: repertory casting returns for shakespeare in the park
item.description: new york's public theater announced its second consecutive summer of casting a repertory company of actors in its two shakespeare in the park productions, "measure for measure" and "all's well that ends well."

item.title: blasts in north iraqi oil city kill up to 25: sources
item.description: three bombs targeting iraqi security forces exploded near government buildings in the center of iraq's disputed northern oil city of kirkuk on thursday, killing up to 25 people and injuring scores, sources said.

item.title: telematics are no longer a sideshow
item.description: nearly every new car will be a connected car in the coming year. they will be using different methods to do it.

item.title: baselworld 2011 | adventureland
item.description: baselworld 2011, which ended today, introduced a slew of new watches made expressly for guys who wear suits of a different kind.

item.title: culture barrier may affect surgeon job satisfaction
item.description: a new study suggests that surgeons who treat a high proportion of hispanic patients tend to be less happy with their jobs than their peers -- a difference, researchers say, that may have much to do with language and cultural barriers.

item.title: shock uk inflation fall eases pressure on boe
item.description: british inflation eased in march for the first time since last summer as grocers cut food prices, reducing the chance of a bank of england rate hike in may and giving it leeway to support the still shaky economy.

item.title: new medtronic stent safe, effective in u.s. trial
item.description: medtronic inc's resolute drug-coated stent met the main safety goals of a large study of u.s. patients, providing the final data the company expects to need to seek u.s. approval of its next generation heart device.

item.title: vieira makes farewell appearance on "today" show
item.description: meredith vieira marked her final appearance as a popular co-host of nbc's top-rated "today" show on wednesday with an emotional farewell, telling her fans: "i will never leave you."

item.title: japan radiation fears mask worse threats to health
item.description: panic over radiation leaks at japan's earthquake-damaged nuclear plant may be diverting attention from potentially worse threats to public health from a tsunami, like the cold and disrupted supplies of water.

item.title: retail sales rise 0.5 percent in april on food, gas
item.description: sales at u.s. retailers posted their smallest gain in nine months in april as high food and gasoline prices drew spending away from other areas, but upward revisions to march's data suggested consumer spending in the first quarter might have been stronger than initially thought.

item.title: do not rely solely on gps for western u.s. travel: experts

item.title: special report: big pharma's global guinea pigs
